paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on two KCNH2 variants associated with long QT syndrome, including penetrance data and functional assessments.

patients.demographics: 1 female (index case, 9 years old), 1 male (brother, asymptomatic), 1 female (mother)
patients.phenotype: long QT syndrome, functional atrioventricular block, Torsades de Pointes

individual_records.phenotype_details: functional atrioventricular block due to very prolonged repolarization (>600 msec) and bifid T waves
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The index case was a product of a consanguineous marriage, born with functional atrioventricular block due to very prolonged repolarization (>600 msec) and bifid T waves.
Her brother (asymptomatic and on nadolol) and mother (primary prevention ICD only) are both heterozygous for the same variant.
Her brother (asymptomatic and on nadolol) and mother (primary prevention ICD only) are both heterozygous for the same variant.

functional_data.summary: Functional investigation using a validated APC assay shows both the homozygous and heterozygous p.(Ile607Phe) exhibiting severe loss of function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The functional evidence for this variant would be recommended to be applied at PS3_strong, which enables the reclassification of p.(Ile607Phe) to a likely pathogenic variant.
key_quotes: Functional investigation using a validated APC assay shows both the homozygous and heterozygous p.(Ile607Phe) exhibiting severe LoF with z-scores of −5.16 and −3.97, respectively.

patients.phenotype: long QT syndrome, episodes of fainting associated with seizures

individual_records.phenotype_details: presented with 2 episodes of fainting associated with seizures, QTc of 550 msec
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband is a 9-year-old male who presented with 2 episodes of fainting associated with seizures.

functional_data.summary: Functional investigation shows that it exhibits a dominant-negative effect, consistent with other severe pore domain in KCNH2 variants.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The z-score for p.(Tyr611Cys) was determined to be −6.63.
key_quotes: Functional investigation shows that it exhibits a dominant-negative effect, consistent with other severe pore domain in KCNH2 variants.

tables_processed.table_caption: ACMG/AMP criteria and classification pre and post functional evidence (PS3)

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
